bridge-type.label: Milight Bridge
bridge-type.description: This bridge represents a Milight device.

parameter.name: ADDR
parameter.label: IP or Host Name
parameter.description: Will be resolved by discovery if auto configured

parameter.name: PASSWORD_BYTE_1
parameter.label: Password Byte 1
parameter.description: Bridge V6 allows to set two password bytes. A value from 0-255 is allowed.

parameter.name: PASSWORD_BYTE_2
parameter.label: Password Byte 2
parameter.description: Bridge V6 allows to set two password bytes. A value from 0-255 is allowed.

parameter.name: REPEAT
parameter.label: Repeat commands
parameter.description: Usually the bridge receives all commands albeit UDP is used. But the actual bulbs might be slightly out of bridge radio range and it sometimes helps to send commands multiple times.

parameter.name: WAIT_BETWEEN_COMMANDS
parameter.label: Wait between commands (ms)
parameter.description: Time to wait before sending another command to the bridge. It is safe to have a wait time of 1/10s but usually sufficient to just wait 50ms. If the value is too high, commands queue up.

parameter.name: CUSTOM_PORT
parameter.label: Custom port
parameter.description: You can set a custom port that will take precedence over the default port which is selected depending on the bridge version: Version 6 uses 5987, Version 3/4/5 uses 8899. Version 2 uses 50000.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.label: Bridge ID
parameter.description: The mac address in upper case letters without delimiter for Version 3+ bridges. Leave empty for Version 1/2 devices. This is used to check if the given IP corresponds to the right device. The bridge is set offline if the device does not respond with the correct Bride ID and a re-detection is started. Useful for DHCP environments where IPs may change over time, after power outage etc. Will be resolved by discovery if auto configured.

parameter.name: CONFIG_PROTOCOL_VERSION
parameter.label: Protocol version
parameter.description: The protocol version might be 3 or 6.

parameter.name: REFRESH_IN_SEC
parameter.label: Refresh interval
parameter.description: Interval in seconds to check for device presence. The Bridge ID is used to check if the IP is still the right one.

thing-type.label: RGB Led
thing-type.description: Milight RGB Led (Without a white channel)

thing-type.label: RGB Led
thing-type.description: Milight RGB Led with white channel. No saturation control. If the set saturation is below a threshold of 50%, the bulb turns into white mode.

thing-type.label: IBox integrated Led
thing-type.description: Integrated led of the ibox bridge

channel-type.label: Nightmode
channel-type.description: Switch to night mode, a very dimmed brightness mode

channel-type.label: Whitemode
channel-type.description: Switch to white mode, which basically sets the saturation to 0 (turns off the color leds)

channel-type.label: Link bulb
channel-type.description: Sync bulb to this zone within 3 seconds of light bulb socket power on

channel-type.label: Unlink bulb
channel-type.description: Clear bulb from this zone within 3 seconds of light bulb socket power on

channel-type.label: Color
channel-type.description: Color of the LED. Bind to a Dimmer to just set the brightness, bind to a Color chooser for the full control and bind to a Switch for turning the led on or off.

channel-type.label: Brightness
channel-type.description: The brightness can be set in 16 steps for RGBW/White leds and in 64 steps for RGBWW leds

channel-type.label: Saturation
channel-type.description: The saturation can be set in 64 steps for RGBWW leds

channel-type.label: Color temperature
channel-type.description: White leds and RGBWW allow to change between a cold and a warm color temperature. White support 16, RGBWW support 64 steps

channel-type.label: Animation speed
channel-type.description: The speed of some animations can be changed

channel-type.label: Animation mode
channel-type.description: Switch to the next/previous animation mode of your RGBW or white LED. Bind this to a Next/Previous channel type.

channel-type.label: Animation mode
channel-type.description: Animation mode of your LED. RGBWW leds support 9 animation modes.
